Perppu Tak Dikeluarkan, ICW Bakal Daftarkan Uji Materi UU KPK Pekan Depan
07 Nov 2019, 19:40 by iman


Perppu Tak Dikeluarkan, ICW Bakal Daftarkan Uji Materi UU KPK Pekan Depan

KBRN, Jakarta: Indonesia Corruption Watch (ICW) kecewa dengan sikap Presiden Joko Widodo yang tak kunjung mengeluarkan Peraturan Pemerintah Pengganti Undang Undang tentang Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) atau Perppu KPK.
Untuk itu, ICW dan Koalisi Masyarakat Sipil Anti Korupsi berencana mengajukan gugatan uji materi Undang-undang Nomor 19 Tahun 2019 tentang Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi ke Mahkamah Konstitusi (MK) pada pekan depan.
"Kami bersama koalisi masyarakat sipil akan lakukan berbagai macam upaya hukum ke Mahakamah Konstitusi, ke lembaga-lembaga negara yang memiliki kewenangan itu untuk melakukan upaya hukum seperti judicial review. Mudah-mudahan minggu depan kami sudah bisa memasukkan judicial review ke MK," kata Peneliti Hukum ICW Donal Fariz, di Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).Menurut Donal salah satu pasal yang menjadi sorotan keberatan pihaknya dalam UU KPK adalah keberadaan Dewan Pengawas KPK. Alasannya, Dewan Pengawas KPK dapat melemahkan kerja KPK.
"Seharsunya Dewan Pengawas bertugas mengevaluasi kerja KPK, namun dalam Undang-undang KPK diatur Dewan Pengawas yang bertugas memberikan izin untuk penyadapan, penggeledahan dan penyitaan," terangnya.Fariz berharap Mahkamah Konstitusi bisa berperan penting untuk menghentikan putusan yang positif dalam uji materi tentang Undang-undang KPK ini.

Perppu Not Issued, ICW Will Register Test Material for the KPK Law Next Week
Nov. 07 2019, 19:40 by faith


Perppu Not Issued, ICW Will Register Test Material for the KPK Law Next Week

KBRN, Jakarta: Indonesia Corruption Watch (ICW) is disappointed with President Joko Widodo's attitude of not issuing Government Regulations in lieu of Laws on Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) or KPK Perppu.
To that end, ICW and the Anti-Corruption Civil Society Coalition plan to file a lawsuit in judicial review of Law Number 19 of 2019 concerning the Corruption Eradication Commission to the Constitutional Court (MK) next week.
"We, together with the coalition of civil society, will make various legal efforts to the Constitutional Court, to state institutions that have the authority to carry out legal efforts such as judicial review. Hopefully next week we will be able to submit judicial review to the Constitutional Court," said the Researcher Legal ICW Donald Fariz, in Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019). According to Donald, one of the articles highlighted by his party in the KPK Law is the existence of the KPK Supervisory Board. The reason is that the KPK Supervisory Board can weaken the work of the KPK.
"The Supervisory Board should have the duty to evaluate the work of the KPK, but in the KPK Law the Supervisory Board regulates the task of giving permission for wiretapping, search and seizure," he explained. Fariz hoped that the Constitutional Court could play an important role in stopping positive decisions in judicial review of the Law invite this KPK.
